author: Vidya Krishnan
text:
In a surprising move, the government has launched a new National Dialysis Services Programme.

End-stage renal disease affects about 2.2 lakh new patients every year.

“This will benefit the medical device industry more than it will benefit the patients,” said an activist on the condition of anonymity.

The rate of year-on-year increase in allocation amounts to just 9.5 per cent while the sector requires an increase of about 50 per cent
title: Dialysis programme
